column4: I have never tried to use an ISA card with *buntu. However, I understand that older hardware should still be supported with an "alternate" CD install. To get it working you need the card set for address 330 (default) or 334 and the aha1542 driver.
I just asked in ##freebsd if the AHA 1542 is still supported with the latest FreeBSD ... answer - yes. Maybe you need to move to FreeBSD for your AHA 1542 adapter.
thanks for asking, I'll dump the card and stick it in the spares bin
according to Kamping_Kaiser you are not going to have success trying to use your old ISA adapter with ubuntu.
